description: Application for a replacement planning permission to extend the time limit for implementation of planning permission ref: P/05/1565 (granted under appeal ref APP/A5270/APS/1194142 dated: 20/03/06) for demolition of existing works and erection of three/four storey care home with basement and off street car parking and landscaping
decision_conditions: The development permitted shall be begun before the expiration of three years from the date of this permission.  REASON:	In order to comply with the provisions of the Town and Country Planning Act 1990 (as amended). | Samples of the materials to be used for the external surfaces of the development shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority before any part of the development is commenced, and this condition shall apply notwithstanding any indications as to these matters which have been given in this application.  Development shall be carried out in accordance with these approved details, unless otherwise agreed in writing by the local planning authority.  Reason: To ensure that the materials harmonise with the surroundings, in accordance with policy 4.1 of the Adopted Ealing Unitary Development Plan, 'Plan for the Environment'(2004). | Full details of the hard and soft landscaping to be undertaken within the site shall be submitted to and approved by the local planning authority prior to the commencement of the development and the approved details shall be laid out and planted within the first planting season following the commencement of the development or such other period as may be agreed in writing with the local planning authority. The submitted information shall include full details of the existing trees and shrubs on the site, details of any trees and shrubs to be retained, together with measures for their protection in the course of the development; details of trees outside the site whose spread of roots should be protected during construction together with measures for their protection; details of the number, species, size and location of all proposed plants and trees, finished levels or contours; car parking layouts; other vehicle and pedestrian access and circulation areas, details of permeable hard surfacing materials, together with details of the size species, position and density of trees to be planted and the time of planting. Any trees or other plants, which die or are removed within the first five years following the implementation of the development, shall be replaced during the next planting season. The development shall thereafter be implemented only in accordance with the approved details, which shall be retained thereafter, unless otherwise agreed in writing by the local planning authority.  Reason: To ensure that the development is landscaped in the interest of the visual character and appearance of the area in accordance with policies 3.1, 3.2, 4.1 and 4.5 of the Adopted Ealing Unitary Development Plan, 'Plan for the Environment'(2004), and Supplementary Planning Guidance 9 Trees and Development Guidelines. | A schedule of landscape maintenance and management for a minimum period of 5 years shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the local planning authority prior to the commencement of the development. The schedule of landscape maintenance shall include details of the arrangements for its implementation. The maintenance scheme shall only be carried out in accordance with the approved schedule,  unless otherwise agreed in writing by the local planning authority.  Reason: To ensure that the development is landscaped in the interest of the visual character and appearance of the area in accordance with policies 4.1 and 4.5 of the Adopted Ealing Unitary Development Plan 'Plan for the Environment' (2004), and Supplementary Planning Guidance 9 Trees and Development Guidelines. | No part of the development hereby permitted shall be occupied until space has been laid out and marked within the site in accordance with drawing number 1044/2_001 for 15 cars (to include 5 spaces as shown for parking for disabled persons) to be parked and for all vehicles to turn so that they may enter and leave the site in forward gear. The parking spaces shall be retained available at all times for car parking without obstruction and shall be used for no other purpose,  unless otherwise agreed in writing by the local planning authority.  Reason: To ensure adequate provision is made for vehicle parking, including for persons with disabilities and in the interests of highway safety in accordance with policy 9.1 of the Adopted adopted policy 9.1  of the Adopted Ealing Unitary Development Plan 'Plan for the Environment' (2004). | Prior to the commencement of development approved by this planning permission (or such other date or stage in development as may be agreed in writing with the Local Planning Authority), the following components of a scheme to deal with the risks associated with contamination of the site shall each be submitted to and approved, in writing, by the local planning authority:  1. A preliminary risk assessment which has identified: ò all previous uses ò potential contaminants associated with those uses ò a conceptual model of the site indicating sources, pathways and receptors ò potentially unacceptable risks arising from contamination at the site.  2. A site investigation scheme, based on (1) to provide information for a detailed assessment of the risk to all receptors that may be affected, including those off site.  3. The site investigation results and the detailed risk assessment (2) and, based on these, an options appraisal and remediation strategy giving full details of the remediation measures required and how they are to be undertaken.  4. A verification plan providing details of the data that will be collected in order to demonstrate that the works set out in (3) are complete and identifying any requirements for longer-term monitoring of pollutant linkages, maintenance and arrangements for contingency action.  Any changes to these components require the express consent of the local planning authority. The scheme shall be implemented as approved.  Reason: To protect health and safety and to prevent pollution of ground water in accordance with policies 2.7 and 4.1 of the adoted Unitary Development Plan 'Plan for the Environment' (2004). | A detailed Green Travel Plan, designed to manage the transport needs of staff, minimise car usage, promote the use of sustainable modes of transport, and reduce on site parking shall be submitted to and approved by the Local Planning Authority prior to the commencement of any work on site, The approved scheme shall be implemented at the time of first occupation of any part of the development and shall be permanently retained in operation thereafter, unless otherwise agreed in writing by the local planning authority.  Reason: To promote sustainable patterns of transport, to safeguard the living and working conditions of local people and in the interests of highway and pedestrian safety, in accordance with policy 9.1 of the Council's adopted Unitary Development Plan 'Plan for the Environment' (2004) and Supplementary Planning Guidance Note 21: Sustainable Transport: Green Travel Plans | Prior to the first occupation of any of the development hereby approved details indicating the positions, appearance, design, materials and type of boundary treatment to be erected on the site shall be submitted to and approved in writing to the Local Planning Authority. Development shall be carried out in accordance with the approved details, which shall be also be completed before the development is first occupied and permanently retained thereafter.  Reason:  To protect the appearance of the area and the amenity of surrounding properties in accordance with policies 3.1, 3.2 and 4.1 of the Council's adopted Unitary Development Plan (UDP) 'New Plan for the Environment'. | Details of refuse storage and collection arrangements and waste recycling facilities shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority prior to the commencement of the development. The facilities shall be provided and available for use before the building is occupied and shall thereafter be permanently retained.  Reason: To ensure adequate refuse storage and waste recycling facilities are provided to meet the needs of the development so as to protect the living conditions for future residents and the health and amenity of the area in accordance with policies 2.11, and 4.1 of the Council's adopted Unitary Development Plan (UDP) 'New Plan for the Environment', and Supplementary Planning Guidance 4. | Details of Accessibility Details of access for people with disabilities, including:(i) 5 disabled car spaces measuring 2.4m by 4.8m, with circulation space of 1.2m to the side and rear;(ii) an assisted toilet that is wheelchair accessible;(iii) an induction loop facility in the communal lounges; (iv) at least 1:10 of the rooms should be wheelchair accessible, having a 1.5m turning circle; (v) all lifts should be wheelchair accessible;shall be submitted to and approved by the Local Planning Authority prior to the commencement of the development hereby permitted on the site, and the approved scheme shall be implemented before the first occupation of the building hereby permitted and shall thereafter be retained.  Reason: To ensure adequate provision for people with disabilities in accordance with adopted policy 4.3 of the Council's adopted Unitary Development Plan (UDP) 'New Plan for the Environment' and Supplementary Planning Guidance 7. | Prior to the commencement of the development details of surface water drainage shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the local planning authority. The details shall include use of permeable /  porous hard surfacing. The approved surface water drainage scheme shall be implemented on the site prior to the first occupation of any part of the development, and retained thereafter unless otherwise agreed in writing by the local planning authority.  Reason: To ensure adequate surface water drainage of the site is carried out, including use of permeable or porous paving for hard surfacing areas, in accordance with policies 2.1, 2.5 and 4.1 of the Adopted Ealing Unitary Development Plan 'Plan for the Environment' (2004), and London Plan Policy 4A.14. | If, during development, contamination not previously identified is found to be present at the site then no further development (unless otherwise agreed in writing with the Local Planning Authority) shall be carried out until the developer has submitted, and obtained written approval from the Local Planning Authority for, an amendment to the remediation strategy detailing how this unsuspected contamination shall be dealt with. The proposed development will only be acceptable if the following measure(s) are implemented and secured by way of a planning condition on any planning permission.  Reason: To protect health and safety and to prevent pollution of ground water in accordance with policies 2.7 and 4.1 of the adoted Unitary Development Plan 'Plan for the Environment' (2004). | Prior to the commencement of the development, details of a site construction method statement and management plan shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority.  The method statement/management plan shall include the following:  -   On-site construction worker parking -   Anticipated number, frequency and size of construction vehicles entering/exiting the site -   Delivery times (staggered to avoid morning and afternoon school run peak periods) -   Dust suppression measures -   Wheel washing provisions -   Site security -   Vehicle manoeuvring and turning, including sweep path diagrams to demonstrate how vehicles will access the site and be able to turn into and emerge from the site in forward gear. -   Details as to the locations for the storage of building materials and construction debris and contractors offices -   Procedures for on-site contractors to deal with complaints from local residents.  Such details shall be implemented, or phasing agreed in writing, prior to the commencement of works on site and thereafter retained for the duration of the works.  Reason:  To ensure appropriate mitigation measures to protect the amenity of local residents and occupiers of the neighbouring sites and ensure adequate highway and site safety, in accordance with policies 4.4, 4.11, 9.1 and 9.9 of the Council's adopted Unitary Development Plan (Plan for the Environment) 2004. | The development hereby permitted shall be carried out in accordance with the following approved plans:  1044/2_001, 1044/1_001 Rev P1, 1044/1_002 Rev P1, 1044/1_003 Rev P1 and 41896/AR/B6   Reason: For the avoidance of doubt and in the interests of proper planning. | The rating noise level emitted from the proposed external plant and machinery at the proposed development shall be lower than the existing background noise level by at least 5 dBA as measured at 3.5 m from the nearest ground floor sensitive facade and 1m from upper floor noise sensitive facades, during the relevant periods of operation.  Reason: To ensure that residents and workers are suitably protected from the transmission of noise so that a suitable working and living environment is maintained, in accordance with policy 4.11 of the adopted Ealing Unitary Development Plan 'Plan for the Environment' (2004) and the Council's adopted Supplementary Planning Guidance 10 'Noise and Vibration'. | The external lighting to be erected, shall comply with the recommendations of the Institution of Lighting Engineers "Guidance Notes for the Reduction of Light Pollution" and the provisions of BS 5489 Part 9. The lighting shall be installed prior to the first use of the development and maintained in accordance with these standards thereafter.  Reason: To provide adequate lighting to the proposed development and protect the living conditions of neighbouring residential properties, and the character of the area in accordance with policies 3.1, 3.2, 4.1 and 4.12 of the adopted Ealing Unitary Development Plan, 'Plan for the Environment' (2004). | Notwithstanding the provisions of the Town and Country Planning (General Permitted Development) Order 1995, the development shall only be used for the approved nursing home use (Use Class C2) as described in the application, and not for any other use without prior approval of the Local Planning Authority obtained by the submission of a planning application.   Reason: To accord with the terms of the application and to protect the employment status of the Employment Location, in accordance with policies 4.1, and 6. of the adopted Ealing Unitary Development Plan 'Plan for Environment' (2004). | Prior to commencement of development, details and drawings of the sustainability measures that are to be incorporated into the development shall be submitted to, and approved in writing by, the Local Planning Authority.  The submitted details shall demonstrate that the development hereby approved will achieve an overall minimum reduction in carbon dioxide emissions by 20%. This reduction should be calculated based on carbon dioxide emissions covered by the Building Regulations plus the carbon dioxide emissions associated with other energy uses not covered by Building Regulations (i.e. regulated and un-regulated). In demonstrating compliance with the overall CO2 reduction requirements, the applicant should adhere to the principles of the Mayor's Energy Hierarchy. The development shall be implemented only in accordance with the approved details, unless otherwise agreed in writing by the local planning authority.  Reason:  To ensure that the development hereby approved is energy efficient and to contribute to the avoidance of need for new fossil fuel or other primary energy generation capacity and to reduce emissions of greenhouse gases, in accordance with policies 4A.1 Tackling Climate Change, 4A.3 Sustainable Design and Construction, 4A.6 Decentralised Energy: Heating, Cooling and Power and 4A.7 Renewable Energy of the London Plan (Consolidated with Alterations since 2004) 2008, Planning and Climate Change - Supplement to Planning Policy Statement 1 (PPS1) and PPS22. | Details to demonstrate that the proposed building will achieve Building Research Establishment BREEAM (or subsequent equivalent quality assured scheme) at least "very good" standard for Multi-Residential shall be submitted to, and approved in writing by, the Local Planning Authority prior to the commencement of the development. The submitted details shall include:  o A Design Stage Assessment showing the design specifications for the building determining the design stage or interim rating o A BREEAM Post Construction Stage Assessment that determines the final score for the building and its achieved BREEAM rating demonstrating the results from all the proposed measures taken to ensure that the development achieves at least BREEAM rating very good.   The development shall be implemented only in accordance with the approved details and the approved sustainability measures shall be implemented and operational prior to first occupation of the development hereby approved and retained thereafter.  Reason: To ensure the adaptation of sustainable design and construction through the use of high energy efficiency measures and the incorporation of sustainable technologies in accordance with policies 4A.3 Sustainable Design and Construction, 4A.7 Renewable Energy of the London Plan (2008), and government advice set out in PPS1, Planning and Climate Change - Supplement to Planning Policy Statement 1 and PPS22. | Details of green roof and the measures within the design of the building to support such works shall be submitted to and approved by the Local Planning Authority prior to the erection of the building containing such roof. These details shall include:   a) biodiversity and/or sedum based with extensive substrate base covering the extent of the roof surface where achievable and reasonable.  b) Sufficient depth of soil or growing medium for the relevant planting c) A mix of species d) Planting within the first planting season following the practical completion of the building works e) Relevant efficient and effective drainage and irrigation to sustain the relevant vegetation f) Evidence that the roof has been installed in accordance with sub-points a) to b) above shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority prior to the first occupation of the development hereby approved.   The development shall only be carried out in accordance with the details so approved and maintained as such thereafter and no change there from shall take place without the prior written consent  of the Local Planning Authority  Reason: To ensure the development provides the maximum possible provision towards creation of habitats and valuable areas of biodiversity in accordance with policies 3D.1; 4A.3, 4A.9 and 4A.11 of the London Plan (Consolidated with Alterations since 2004) 2008 and policy 3.8 of the adopted Ealing Unitary Development Plan "Plan for the Environment" (2004).
